PathProblem dataclass

Describes a path problem to be solved by Link.

class PathProblem.PathProblem(state_grid, start_pos, goal_pos, start_directions, goal_directions, transition_points, starting_part, part_stock, part_cost, weights, algorithm='mcsa*')

Bases: object

Dataclass that contains detailed information about a path problem.

algorithm

Defines how scores are calculated and therefore how nodes are evaluated in the search.

Type: (:obj: str)

goal_directions

Set containing directions that restrict in which direction the search algorithm can append to the goal.

Type: (set[Pos])

goal_pos

Goal position that needs to be reached

Type: (Pos)

part_cost

Part IDs pointing to their cost value.

Type: (dict [int, float])

part_stock

Part IDs pointing the amount of parts available for assembly.

Type: (set[PartStock])

start_directions

Set containing directions that restrict in which direction the search algorithm can start the search.

Type: (set[Pos])

start_pos

Start position of the search.

Type: (Pos)

starting_part

Part ID that is placed at the start point (Error will be raised, if this is not a fitting ID, since this is a placeholder for potential features implemented in the future)

Type: (Optional [int])

state_grid

See StateGrid

transition_points

Set containing transition points that show where a transition from one wall to another occurs.

Type: (set[Pos])

weights

Weights used if search algorithm is a multi-criteria search algorithm (mca*, mcsa*)

Type: (:obj`Optional` [Weights])
